ARABIC: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: By the Lord of heaven and earth, it is certainly the truth, just as you have speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: By the Lord of the heavens and the earth, this is certainly true even as you speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So, by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, this is certainly true, as true as the fact of your speaking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This, by the Lord of the heavens and the earth is as certain as your ability to speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So by oath of the Lord of the heavens and the earth, this Qur’an is the Truth, in the same language that you speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth, just as you can speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth! it is most surely the truth, just as you do speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So by the Lord of heaven and earth, it is as surely true as that you have speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, it is the truth, even as (it is true) that ye speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is certainly the truth. It is as true as your ability to speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the Lord of the heaven and the earth it is sure, even as it is a fact that ye are speaking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: By the Lord of the sky and the earth, it is indeed the truth, just as [it is a fact that] you speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then, by the Lord of heaven and earth, this is the very Truth, as much as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then, by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth (i.e. what has been promised to you), just as it is the truth that you can speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So by the Lord of heaven and earth, it is as true as your speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is as true as the fact that you speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:23] So by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it, that which you are promised, is as assuredly true as [the fact] that you have [power of] speech (read mithlu, in the nominative, as an adjective, with the mā being extra; or read mithla, in the accusative, as being a compound with mā), that is to say: [it is as true] as your speech is in reality, that is, in your knowing it to be [true] necessarily by its issuing from you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth) Allah swore by Himself, (it) that which I have related to you concerning provision (is the Truth) it will surely happen, (even as (it is true) that ye speak) even as you say: there is no deity except Allah.
